MARKETING CLOUD GROWTH
Create an Identity Resolution Ruleset for Marketing Cloud Growth

Identity resolution is a critical step to organizing and unifying your data. Usually, when your data originates from many systems, it’s modeled and labeled differently in each place. Identity resolution rulesets define the relationships among data model objects (DMOs) and their fields. After you configure these rules, Data Cloud can organize related and duplicate data into unified individual records that marketers can use to target audiences.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited Editions with Marketing Cloud Growth Edition

We recommend creating only one identity resolution ruleset for your Marketing Cloud Growth data. You can create multiple reconciliation rules inside your ruleset.

In Marketing Cloud Growth, on the Identity Resolutions tab, click New.
Select the default data space, and select Individual for the Primary Data Model Object.
Name the ruleset and save it.
On the identity resolution record, in the Match Rules section, click Configure.
Follow the prompts to create rules that determine when to unify related records.
Define which Unified Individual object to use for personalization.
From Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter Basic, and select Basic Settings.
On the Marketing Data tab, in the Create an Identity Resolution Ruleset section, select the Unified Individual object associated with your ruleset.

You can do more with identity resolution, such as create defaults or troubleshoot warnings. For details about fuzzy matching and other ruleset information, see Salesforce Help for Data Cloud.
